algorithm_technique: Greedy simulation of game turns, tracking available words and player turns.
problem_summary_simple: Alice and Bob play a word game. Players must play a word lexicographically greater than the last, with a specific first letter rule. Alice wins if she can force a win.
problem_summary_technical: Simulates a turn-based game where players select words from sorted lists based on lexicographical order and first letter constraints, determining winnability.
key_insights: The game can be simulated turn by turn, focusing on the current player's best move.
The 'closely greater' condition simplifies to checking the first letter and lexicographical order.
The problem can be viewed as a state-space search, but a greedy approach works due to the sorted nature of the input arrays.
